title: Missing files in result from datalad get and drop for identical files
body:
#### What is the problem?
If in a given folder (including its subfolders), many files happen to have the same content, when doing a `datalad get`on the parent folder, the result only contains an entry for one of the files. The same is also taking place when using `datalad drop` on a folder with many identical files.
#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Inside a dataset, create a folder. Inside that folder, create 2 copies of the same file with different names. Then create a subfolder and copy the previously created file in this subfolder with a different name.
2. Use `datalad save` and `datalad publish` to send the data to any remote.
3. Use `datalad drop` to drop the folder through the Python API. The result will only display one path for a dropped file as if only a single file was dropped although three files were dropped.
3. Use `datalad get` on the first folder created in step one using the Python API. Looking at the result will only display one path for the file as they all share the same annexkey.
#### What version of DataLad are you using?
Datalad: datalad 0.10.1
OS: Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
I am not sure if this is a limitation from git-annex or this this was a design choice. I understand that git-annex uses the files MD5 to generate the annex key so in reality, only one git-annex object is gotten and dropped each time. However, I believe it could be a nice addition for the user to have a list of paths when many files point to the same git-annex object.
